Class MidiPlayer

  • Object
    • MidiPlayer
  • public class MidiPlayer
extends Object
    MidiPlayer can be used to play a sequence of notes on a MIDI device. A sequence of notes can be programmed into the player using the provided addNote methods. The instrument used to play the note can be changed using the changeInstrument method. After the notes are programmed, you can play the sequence of notes using the play method. MidiPlayer player = new MidiPlayer(); player.addNote(60, 0, 1); // 60 is middle C. Note starts at beat 0 and ends at beat 1. player.changeInstrument(13); player.play();
    Author:
    Marissa Schmidt

    • Method Detail

      • addNote

        public void addNote​(int note,
                    double startTime,
                    double endTime)
        Adds a note to the player. The note will play at the starting time and continue to play until the ending time. The notes for some instruments fade out and will not span the entire time.
        Parameters:
        note - The note to play (60 is middle C).
        startTime - The time to start playing the note (in seconds).
        endTime - The time to stop playing the note (in seconds).

      • addNote

        public void addNote​(int note,
                    double startTime,
                    double endTime,
                    int volume)
        Adds a note to the player. The note will play at the starting time and continue to play until the ending time. The notes for some instruments fade out and will not span the entire time.
        Parameters:
        note - The note to play (60 is middle C).
        startTime - The time to start playing the note (in seconds).
        endTime - The time to stop playing the note (in seconds).
        volume - The volume of the note (0 - 127).

      • setTempo

        public void setTempo​(int bpm)
        Sets the tempo in beats per minute.
        Parameters:
        bpm - Beats per minute.

      • changeInstrument

        public void changeInstrument​(int instrument,
                             double time)
        Changes the instrument for the player starting at the provided time.
        Parameters:
        instrument - The instrument id. This will differ on various machines. You can play with the numbers.
        time - The time to change the instrument.

      • play

        public void play()
        Plays the sequence of notes programmed into the player. This should be the last method you call.

      • printInstrumentList

        public void printInstrumentList()
        Prints the list of available instruments to the console. For debugging purposes only.
